intro: Leptinella pyrethrifolia var. pyrethrifolia, commonly known as the Alpine penny-cress, is a low-growing perennial herb native to the alpine regions of Europe and western Asia. It typically reaches heights of 10–30 cm, with small, clustered leaves and bright yellow flowers that bloom in early spring. The plant thrives in rocky, well-drained soils and is adapted to cold, high-altitude environments. It is characterized by its aromatic foliage and is often found in meadows and mountainous areas. This species is also valued for its historical use in herbal medicine and as a source of natural insecticides.
